pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.1: Nuns’ suspension 7, 8, and 9 are identical to the monks’ suspension 5 [](pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:0.4), 8 [](pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:0.4), and 9 [](pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:0.4) respectively.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.59: _Ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ_. The Pali text just says _dukkaṭa_, without specifying that it is an _āpatti_, an offense. Yet just below the text says that the _dukkaṭa_ is annulled if you commit the full offense of _saṅghādisesa_. The implication is that _dukkaṭa_ should be read as _āpatti dukkaṭassa_, “an offense of wrong conduct”.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.3.6: The Pali says the “seventh offense”, but since I am including the rules that the nuns have in common with the monks in the count, I get “tenth offense” instead. The same adjustment is required for the next three rules.
